basics.name: Gregory Danielson III
basics.label: Software Engineering Team Lead
basics.summary: Software Engineering Team Lead with a focus on community safety and natural language processing. Four-year track record in developing technologies to detect illicit activity on social platforms, fortified by robust leadership and DevOps skills. Lives by 'Test, Review, Adjust'.

work.name: UAB Computer Forensics Research Laboratory
work.summary: Leading the development of state of the art discovery and analysis technologies for identifying criminal actors on social media
highlights: Led research and implementation of a facial recognition index built on our social media data, created with python's deepface and elasticsearch's small world graph discovery
Re-designed production systems to build onto a cloud-lite Kubernetes cluster to enable faster iteration on products and services
Trained incoming developers on our systems, technologies, and development methodology to encourage success
Implemented binary classification machine learning techniques using Pytorch, Transformers to aid identification of relevant research targets

work.name: UAB Computer Forensics Research Laboratory
work.summary: Database and systems administration, devops, backend development, archicture, technical leadership.
highlights: Led technical projects to the signing of several high-value contracts, including the acquisition of a $750,000 contract for our work on Twitter
Developed and maintained tools for capturing content from social media including Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and other OSINT data sources
Developed a data model for storing and accessing mass social media data across multiple platforms to/from a highly available PostgreSQL cluster
Contributed to and designed many supportive React and Svelte webapps with a an asynchronous python web backend for accessing and analyzing aforementioned captured data

Re-designed devops and deployment process into highly automated structured test, report, iterate, deploy scheme on Gitlab CI and Github Actions, resulting in faster bug report response, faster iteration, more uptime
Deployed and administrated an Elasticsearch cluster, allowing elasticsearch-supported full text search in the form of a PostgreSQL index
Maintained and administered a pair of high performance CentOS servers for serving end users, mass compute, mass storage of data, running workers for aforementioned data capturing tools

work.name: University of Alabama at Birmingham
highlights: Developed and re-designed assignment structure to balance challenge with progress
Created most documents used in lab materials
Developed consistent grading methodology for team of TAs
Ensured the success of hundreds of students in deeply understanding intel x86_64 ASM

awards.title: President's List
awards.summary: Qualified for President's List (achieved 4.0 GPA in 12+ credit hours of classes) in 3 out of 8 semesters.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Qualified for Dean's's List (achieved  >=3.6 GPA in 12+ credit hours of classes) in 4 out of 8 semesters.

certificates.title: Cyber Security Certificate
certificates.summary: Successfully completed a series of courses on technological security throughout the completion of a Master of Science in Computer Science.

references.name: Gary Warner
references.position: Lab Coordinator at Computer Forensics Research Laboratory, Professor at University of Alabama at Birmingham

references.name: Mahmut Unan
references.position: Professor, Researcher at University of Alabama at Birmingham

projects.name: Linku: a Toki Pona dictionary in a bot, site, and database
projects.description: Toki Pona previously had dozens of differently thorough and opinionated dictionaries. Now it has one, and a collection of tools to make that data accessible.
highlights: Re-designed search in web dictionary to better match user expectations
Applied same search improvements to bot with special consideration for its Discord interface
Automated updating font data to support pre-existing metadata ecosystem
Designed a reproducible prod environment for bot
Adjusted JSON schema to improve querying consistency for certain obscure data (etymology)

projects.name: ilo pi toki pona taso: Tool for only Toki Pona
projects.description: A Discord bot that enforces anyone and everyone speaks Toki Pona- add to your server now!
highlights: Responds near instantly to use in ~20 servers, including the >10,000 member 'ma pona pi toki pona'
Massively customizable behavior for both servers and end users

projects.name: wttr.in
projects.description: A weather service for your terminal. `curl wttr.in`
highlights: Corrected a longstanding bug where the province (or state, for the US) would be omitted when searching for the current weather. For example, searching for the weather from Helena, Alabama would return the weather for Helena, Montana.
Adjusted the cache system in a backwards compatible manner to preserve all metadata from geolocation lookups.
